creator: davidsk

content: I don't know why Thunderbird is the culprit, as you also access the mail via other items. My suggestion is to first carefully review the setup for the account on each device. Are they all IMAP, or are some POP? And what are the specific settings for each? For example, one of those setups might be POP and set to download and delete after x days. That is a challenge seen regularly here where users access mail across more than one platform.
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks for your reply - have checked and all are IMAP. Can't see anywhere to find a setting which would download and delete. Any further ideas please?
creator: sue.saunders35

content: I wish I did. Thunderbird has no facility to delete one account after two weeks. However, Thunderbird deletes junk mail after 14 days, so you may need to see if that is a possibility on one of your devices.
creator: davidsk

content: Se gli account sono configurati come IMAP, assicurati anzitutto di aver sottoscritto le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/sincronizzazione-imap#w_configurazione-della-sincronizzazione-ed-utilizzo-dello-spazio-sul-disco
creator: @next

content: Your emails are apparently violating the receiver's sender use policy. For example, you may be sending attachments that are considered insecure.
creator: davidsk

content: I did not send out any attachments with the emails being rejected... any other solutions...
creator: tseale

content: I don't understand. You stated that Thunderbird marks it as junk. What else would you have it do?
creator: davidsk

content: Thunderbird is just a messenger; it sends messages from your IP address, using server configuration details that are provided by you, and reports messages from receiving servers back to you. I do recall a while back seeing a user being blacklisted from emails sent by Thunderbird, but that was due to an advertisement being embedded in messages by an anti-virus program. Thunderbird was just the unwitting carrier. With more information on the blacklist, someone here may have suggestions.
creator: davidsk

content: Was actually being caused by the Norton VPN.
creator: bryanmepstein

content:
Seems that replacing the session.json file for the profile with the session.json.backup (essentially removing the reference to the previously open tab) has, at least for now, cleared up this issue.

Will be watching the system behavior. and report back if the situation recurs.
creator: cl1
